Cat Cafe (2025)

In mid-April 2025, I was approached by the event coordinator to create marketing materials for the annual Cat Cafe event. As part of Mental Health Awareness Month, Neko Cat CafÃ© hosted a cozy, relaxing evening with furry feline friends.

I had the opportunity to develop a fresh visual style for the event, aiming to create something unique and memorable. Drawing inspiration from mid-century modern design and minimalist yet bold aesthetics, I crafted a look that set this Cat Cafe event apart.

Roles:

  • Visual Direction
  • Graphic Design
  • Illustration
  • Brand Identity

Sketches

My initial sketches explored four different concepts: two cats sharing a kiss, cats on shelves, cats separated by an invisible grid, and cats on a windowsill surrounded by greenery and outdoor elements.

After discussing with the event coordinator, we decided to merge the shelves concept with the spaced-out grid approach. This combination allowed for an airy composition and provided space for the elements and information to interact in a dynamic way.

Digitizing

I initially illustrated many elements, but my main concern was overwhelming the composition. Since this event poster needed to captivate a student audience at a fleeting glance, I decided to minimize the main illustrations. I leaned into a Bauhaus-inspired style, rather than the prominent mid-century modern look I originally envisioned, to achieve a cleaner and more impactful design.
